chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kobe Deshaun Newble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sale/Possess/Use/Transport Machine Gun, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.26(1g)(a).
  • Possession Of A Firearm By Adjudicated Delinquent, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 149 days time served.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years.

superMiscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

No use of illegal drugs without a valid prescription.
No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of firearms or body armor.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 7&8:
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC and during extended supervision.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with   count 7 and with sentences in 21CF3858. Credit for 149 days time served.

charges.descr: Possession Of A Firearm By Adjudicated Delinquent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kobe Deshaun Newble

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING, AM (49 pages) commencing 08-26-22 by LISA DIAMOND.

Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Cobe Deshaun Newble.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Court made oral ruling as to spelling of defendant's first name.  Cobe (should be) Kobe.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  Defendant sworn.

As to Counts 7 & 8: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

As to Count 9: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 7: Court ordered defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 Years, Concurrent with sentences in Case 21 cf 3858, credit for 149 Days time served.    The initial term of  confinement is 3 Years, Extended supervision is 3 years.

AS TO COUNT 8:  Court ordered defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 9 years, Concurrent with Count 7 and with sentences in case 21 cf 3858, credit for 149 Days time served.   The initial term of  confinement is 4 Years, Extended supervision is 5 years.

The Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision as to counts 7 & 8:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, Random urine screens
- No use of illegal drugs without a valid prescription
- Seek and Maintain employment
- No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No use of possession of firearms or body armor.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from Prison Funds at a rate to be determined by DOC and during extended supervision.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.  
filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  mn

Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Cobe Deshaun Newble.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution, defense requests plea and sentencing date. Motion to withdraw is withdrawn. Case adjourned, Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea hearing. Defendant wishes to retain private counsel. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case scheduled for global resolution in Branch 02. Plea hearing 06-17-2022 at 10:00 am, Branch 2.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests case be transfered to Judge Childs for global resolution. Case adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail

Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Domine.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with co-def:  Orlando Cain
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Defendant Cobe Deshaun Newble in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cobe Deshaun Newble appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
